Here's the corrected HTML based on the WCAG 2.1 violation description and the provided examples:

- Incorrect HTML: <a href="https://www.intapp.com/firms/rsm/" id="firms_rsm">
- Thought: I need to correct the above HTML by adding a title attribute to the link. Since the "href" is a URL, I can search the URL to get context on what the title content should be. Based on the URL, it seems to be a page about a firm named "RSM" on the Intapp website.
- Corrected HTML: <a href="https://www.intapp.com/firms/rsm/" id="firms_rsm" title="RSM Firm">

By adding the title attribute with the value "RSM Firm", the link now has accessible text that can be read by screen readers, making it compliant with the WCAG 2.1 guidelines.
